Container.Name: Postfix-Relay
Container.Overview:
This runs Postfix (as a relay) in Docker. Most home ISPs block port 25, so outbound emails must be relayed through an external SMTP server (e.g., Gmail). This container acts as a single collections point for devices needing to send email. ⚠️ Postfix acts as an open relay. As such, this is not meant to be run on the internet, only on a trusted internal network! ⚠️
Requirements You must already have a account on an external SMTP server (e.g., Gmail, AWS SES, etc...). Your external SMTP server must be using encryption (i.e., plaintext is not allowed)

Config.Name: Data Directory
Config.Description: Used to store Postfix's mail spool

Config.Name: Public SMTP
Config.Description: Public SMTP server to use must be using encryption (i.e., plaintext is not allowed)

Config.Name: SMTP password
Config.Description: Password to login to $RELAY_HOST If using Gmail 2FA, you will need to setup an app password

Config.Name: Enable Submissions
Config.Description: When 'true', use SUBMISSIONS protocol (formerly called SMTPS) instead of using the STARTTLS command.

Config.Name: Test Email address
Config.Description: Address to receive test email If not set, test email will not be sent

Config.Name: Test Email Subject
Config.Description: Sets the subject of the test email sent on docker startup. Useful when running multiple instances.

Config.Name: Networks
Config.Description: Networks that Postfix will forward mail for

Config.Name: Message Size
Config.Description: Maximum email size in bytes, including envelope information.

Config.Name: Disable logging
Config.Description: When 'true', docker logging is disabled. When 'false', docker logging is to stdout.
